fields.description:
Certain fields in admin should only be writable if there is a key in {{confluence.cfg.xml}} and it is set to true.

This is to prevent malicious Confluence administrators (as opposed to system administrators, who have filesystem-level access) from modifying settings in the admin screens which would elevate their privileges or retrieve information which they should not have access to.
fields.summary: Allow write configuration of certain fields in administration section

fields.summary: Documentation theme - print out doesn't display comments properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19324].
  {panel}

If an attacker has gained system admin access to Confluence, they can upload a plugin which can perform malicious activities with the same permissions as the Confluence application (e.g. write files to locations on the filesystem where the Confluence application user has write permission).

There is currently no way for Confluence administrators to restrict the powers of plugin code running in Confluence.

One potential solution is to define a [Java Security Policy|http://articles.techrepublic.com.com/5100-10878_11-6178805.html] which can be implemented with the Java SecurityManager. Previously we had an unsupported document which described how to run Confluence with a policy that restricted some access on the filesystem, but not much else:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF29/Java+Policy+Security+with+Confluence
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/Java+Policy+Security+with+Confluence (currently locked as Obsolete)

It would be good if this document was extended to limit functionality further, and tested properly so it could be supported by Atlassian for use in production. It could provide a good way for the administrator to limit the powers available to plugins and provide a layer of security when installing new plugins.

Another related issue is CONF-20287, restricting the ability to upload plugins through the web interface.
fields.summary: Allow administrator to restrict and control plugin functionality in Confluence
Clean up calls to addActionError(String) that do not use i18n keys

fields.description:
Create a confluence user with whitespace in their user name, like 'test user'.
Create a home page in their personal space.
From that page like http://confluence.acme.earth/display/~test+user/Home, 
click the Tools menu and choose Restrictions.

EXPECTED RESULT: Pages Restrictions popup dialog opens
ACTUAL RESULT: Nothing. Upon further investigation, what is silently happening is a call is being made to getpagepemerssionsaction which is being intercepted by SpaceAwareInterceptor which is returning null in its initial getSpace() call. Thus an HTTP 404 is returned by the AJAX call and thus the user sees nothing.
fields.summary: Cannot execute Tools -> Restrictions from Personal Spaces of users with whitespace in their user name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Running a request against Confluence with Accept header that contains "application/json" returns an authentication error.

h3. Environment

* Confluence running over SSL

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up Confluence to run over SSL
# Run a *curl* command with application/json header

h3. Expected Results

The application returns the expected JSON.

h3. Actual Results

401 error is returned with an authentication requirement:

{code}
$ curl -v -k --insecure  https://localhost:8443 --header "Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/json;q=0.9"
* Rebuilt URL to: https://localhost:8443/
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* Connected to localhost (127.0.0.1) port 8443 (#0)
* TLS 1.2 connection using TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
* Server certificate: bandreeti
> GET / HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:8443
> User-Agent: curl/7.43.0
> Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/json;q=0.9
>
< HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized
< Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
< X-Confluence-Request-Time: 1489679589469
< Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=7C92CB07865D341DA3DD8E29B9A8E987; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
< X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
< X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
< X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
< Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self'
< WWW-Authenticate: OAuth realm="https%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A8443"
< Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
< Transfer-Encoding: chunked
< Date: Thu, 16 Mar 2017 15:53:09 GMT
<
* Connection #0 to host localhost left intact
{"errorMessage":"You are not logged in. <a href=\"/login.action\">Log in<\/a> here and try again."}
{code}
 
h3. Notes

This is a problem for web developers, who may have plugins installed which modify the browser accept header to accept JSON for various reasons. For now, they have to disable such plugins manually in order to use Confluence effectively.

h3.Workaround

If you pass the *-u* parameter with an username and password, the request is accepted:

{code}
$ curl -v -k --insecure -u <username>:<password>  https://localhost:8443 --header "Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/json;q=0.9"
* Rebuilt URL to: https://localhost:8443/
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
* Connected to localhost (127.0.0.1) port 8443 (#0)
* TLS 1.2 connection using TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
* Server certificate: bandreeti
* Server auth using Basic with user '<username>'
> GET / HTTP/1.1
> Host: localhost:8443
> Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4=
> User-Agent: curl/7.43.0
> Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/json;q=0.9
>
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
< X-Confluence-Request-Time: 1489677615306
< Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=4CF30D4D1E4F5B335F1D0FE3AE939662; Path=/; Secure; HttpOnly
< X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
< X-AUSERNAME: <username>
< X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
< X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
< X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
< Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'self'
< X-Accel-Buffering: no
< Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
< Transfer-Encoding: chunked
< Date: Thu, 16 Mar 2017 15:20:15 GMT
<

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
                            <title>Dashboard - Confluence</title>
...
{code}

This user credentials are not required in JIRA.

The -k --insecure parameters are just to workaround the self-signed certificate.
fields.summary: Authentication Requirement when Running application/json Headers Against Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19256].
  {panel}

Very useful would be to have the possibility to REMOTELY (via webservice remote api) define/retrieve metadata key/value pair OUTSIDE wiki content, in order
- to protect them
- to be outside content (they are data about data)
- enable more formal location of metadata
- this formalism would enable more structured and predictable enforcement on:
1. force user to compile metadata
2. auto compile metadata
3. allow remote API to quick fetch metadata programmatically and related content

thanks
fields.summary: Access and exposing "content api" api remotely

When building a custom dashboard with macros e.g. using Theme Builder the macro recently-updated-dashboard cannot be filtered for special groups of spaces like favourites or new spaces.

On the default dashboard the recently updated part is synchronized with the spaces part.

Improvements suggestions
 * implement the same special space keys as in [recently-updated|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/_wIcCg]
 * further listen to the spacesSelectedTab parameter and automatically filter spaces according to it
 * filtering by community membership would also be great!

fields.description:
The list of blogs in a space for a particular month should be ordered like a blog, in reverse order by posting date. See our public blog for example:

http://blogs.atlassian.com/news/2010/02/

Currently, it is ordered by posting date with the oldest at the top. We should reverse this order. See our extranet for a current example:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/2010/03/

The same problem applies to the list of posts on the right-hand side of the blog page.

(Marking as affects 3.3-m1, but might also be a stable, i.e. 3.2, bug.)
fields.summary: Blog posts list for a space is ordered incorrectly - should be reverse chronologically

fields.description:
I received my daily e-mail digest "[confluence] Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours" today and noticed all the comment links are broken.

The links appear as:
$webwork.htmlEncode($content.displayTitle) has a new comment [ user]

And link to:
https://extranet.atlassian.com$content.urlpath/

The links should appear as:
Page Name has a new comment [user]
And the link should actually work. Also note that there is a space between [ and the username which probably shouldn't be there.

Also, an e-mail I received on 1 Apr 2010 did not have this issue.
fields.summary: Daily e-mail digest comments links broken

fields.description:
The daily update has content like -

{noformat}
Dusan Hornik


Comments

$webwork.htmlEncode($content.displayTitle) has 7 new comments [ jtaylor, tmoore, mknighten, jdumay, doflynn, fschmitz, edawson] 
John Sloat


Comments

$webwork.htmlEncode($content.displayTitle) has 2 new comments [ lhardy, jdumay] 
{noformat}
fields.summary: Daily e-mail update is missing content titles - has $webwork.htmlEncode ... instead

fields.description:
The search string for livesearch macro is ignored in IE using livesearch macro. The URL produced using livesearch is:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?s=hello&quickSearch=true&where=&queryString=

This can be replicated on the official site: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Livesearch+Macro

However dynamic search results do appear prior to pushing enter. Also, users can navigate the dynamic search results.

This behaviour can not be reproduced in Firefox.


Steps to reproduce:
To reproduce this bug, open ie 6, 7 or 8
Create a page with the livesearch macro or navigate to this link in the documentation:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Livesearch+Macro

Type in a search term that will produce a known result and use the mouse to click "go"

Choosing a search result from the menu will not reproduce the bug.

The result is a page with an empty search box.

IE produced this error:
Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0)
Timestamp: Thu, 8 Apr 2010 01:02:08 UTC

Message: Object doesn't support this property or method
Line: 254
Char: 29
Code: 0
URI: https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/s/1901/59/2.11.1/_/download/batch/confluence.extra.livesearch:livesearch-macro-web-resources/confluence.extra.livesearch:livesearch-macro-web-resources.js
fields.summary: livesearch macro doesn't work properly on IE6 , IE7 and IE8

fields.description:
We have complete translation of confluence 3.0.2. After upgrading from 3.0.2 to 3.1.1 the translation of GeneralUtil.java section in  ConfluenceActionSupport does not work (we do not see translated time in recently-updated macro content, e.g. "updated less then a minute ago" is now translated as "zmenené less than a minute ago"). 
Translation of other sections seems to work fine (in ConfluenceActionSupport file the lines above and also below the translation).

The section looks like:

################################################################
# ACTION:   GeneralUtil.java
################################################################

show-less=Uk\u00e1za\u0165 menej 
show-more=Uk\u00e1za\u0165 viac
one.day.ago=1 de\u0148 dozadu
x.days.ago={0} dni(-\u00ed) dozadu
one.hour.ago=hodinu dozadu
x.hours.ago={0} hodiny(-\u00edn) dozadu
one.min.ago=min\u00fatu dozadu
x.mins.ago={0} min\u00fat dozadu
less.than.one.min=menej ne\u017e min\u00fatu dozadu 

date.friendly.now=pr\u00e1ve teraz
date.friendly.a.moment.ago=pred chv\u00ed\u013eou 
date.friendly.about.one.hour.ago=pribli\u017ene pred hodinou 
date.friendly.about.x.hours.ago=pribli\u017ene {0} hodiny(-\u00edn) dozadu
date.friendly.formatted={0}
date.friendly.yesterday=v\u010dera o {0}


What might be the cause of the problem?
fields.summary: recently-updated macro is ignoring GeneralUtil.java ACTION section in translation

fields.description:
Full Image does not Open After Clicking on Thumbnail if the server base URL is not configure correctly. After clicking on the thumbnail, Confluence only shows a continuously spinning loading icon as shown below:

\\
!symptom.PNG|thumbnail!

Steps to replicate 
# Set the server base URL via _Administration Console >> Administration Console >> Site Configuration >> Server Base Url_ to incorrect URL. (eg: http://localhost:8080)
# Now on the same machine upload a new image and use the following example macro shown below:
{code}
!<image file>|thumbnail!
{code}
*NOTE:* Please change the *<image file>* according to the image file name you have uploaded.
# Now grab another machine try to click on the thumbnail.
fields.summary: Full Image does not Open After Clicking on Thumbnail

fields.description:
If the 'JavaScript served in header' option is set to Off in the General Configuration, autocomplete does not work and anything to do with the Links Browser breaks (the Insert Link button does not load in the WYSIWYG editor and the Insert > Link, Insert > Attachment and the Insert Attachment buttons do nothing).

Furthermore, the sidebar for the General Configuration screen recommends to set the 'JavaScript served in header' option to Off to increase page load performance. It warns that it might disable some plugins, but doesn't mention which ones or that autocomplete/the Links Browser will be affected.
fields.summary: 'JavaScript served in header' option disables Link Browser and Autocomplete

fields.description:
Scenario:
Access the links browser via the keybaord shortcut or the links icon in the editor toolbar, then click on "Web Link" and paste a link (eg http://google.com). You then leave the link text field empty and press insert. 

Outcome:
This inserts a web link to http://google.com, with the link alias of http://google.com. IE if no link alias is entered in the Web Link, it defaults to the link URL itself.

Problem:
This does not work if you access the links browser via autocomplete. Steps to reproduce:

1. Type [ 
2. Keypress up and hit enter on "Insert web link"
3. Paste your web-link (eg http://google.com)
4. Press Insert (or hit enter)

This does not insert anything in the RTE. Expected: http://google.com is inserted and links off to http://google.com
fields.summary: Links Browser 'Web Link' does not default link text if you use auto-complete

fields.description:
As part of CONF-18196 we went through and marked all translations that were missing from the german and french language packs. 

We then decided the deprecate the themes and not go through with the translations but didn't go back and remove the markers. So now 3.2 has a whole bunch of "Needs to be updated" messages in the left nav theme.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19214].
  {panel}

Page dialogs are difficult to navigate on low resolution screens (small height, especially) like 800*600, 1200*800 and 1280*600. There is simply no scroll bar (vertical/horizontal) to navigate around the dialog.

Example page dialogs:

* Move page
* Page restrictions
* Insert image
* Macro browser
* Links browser
fields.summary: Display scrollbars on dialogs to support low resolution screens

fields.description:
When adding the Quicknav Gadget, it doesn't display suggested results correctly.  In both the preview window and in the saved page, the suggested results look like this screen shot:

!borkedQuicknav.png!

The same behavior occurs in Firefox and Chrome.  The width of the odd display area corresponds to the width of the text.

Steps to reproduce:

# Edit or add a new page
# Attempt to add the quicknav gadget
# Start typing search terms in the preview.  Note the odd display.
# Save the page with the gadget
# Start typing search terms in the quicknav gadget.  Note the same odd display.
fields.summary: Quicknav gadget has display problems

fields.summary: Unable to export PDF file when page title contains quotes

fields.description:
Confluence cannot undo a striked through text when using text editor.

Steps to replicate:
# Mark a text as striked through in RTE.
# Save.
# Edit the page again and try to un-strike through by clicking on the strike through button.

The work around is to edit in wiki markup. 

This may sound like a simple bug, but can hinder the adoption of Confluence by business users.
fields.summary: Cannot undo strike through in Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
Add page
open link browser
search for "st"

bottom of search results will be cut off.

see attached screenshot
fields.summary: Link Browser search box bottom is cut off in FF 3.5 only
Fix Javadoc process

fields.description:
The javadoc for Confluence 3.2 is currently available at http://maven.atlassian.com/public/com/atlassian/confluence/confluence/3.2/confluence-3.2-javadoc.jar but not at http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/

Furthermore, the doc in the maven repo probably has some out of date links as well.  Eg its link to the renderer doc is definitely wrong.
fields.summary: Upload javadoc for Confluence 3.2 to docs.atlassian.com

fields.description:
See attached screenshot

Created a page named:
Page with a supercallafragilisticexpeeallidotiously long title 

This title is rendered incorrectly when found through search in the links browser (looks fine when searching from confluence search box).

Only happens in IE8
fields.summary: Link Browser in IE 8 only does not render correctly for pages with very long names

fields.description:
When the links browser is closed and a link has been inserted or edited, the link is highlighted.  This will cause the link to be deleted when the user starts typing.

After a link is inserted, the cursor should be in the space next to the link.

This has been an issue before:  CONF-18671
fields.summary: Insert Link when dialog is finished and link inserted, it should not be selected

fields.description: Confluence 3.3 needs to be upgraded to include Plugins 2.5 and SAL 2.1. This is important for UPM which is due to work alongside Confluence 3.3.
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence to Plugins 2.5 and SAL 2.1

fields.description:
When adding or opening a page, the top right corner of the wiki markup page is not rendering correctly.  The corner of the scrollbar is underneath the gray shaded area.  (see screenshot)

This also means that any text in the first line of the wiki markup editor is invisible.  I just added a macro to a page, and I can't see the macro I added.
fields.summary: add or edit page - top right corner of scroll bar not rendered correctly ie7 only

fields.description:
On the personal space dashboard,

The amount of time listed in "recently updated" is only allowing 1-3 chars per line when right nav column is expanded.  (See screenshot.)

It should render consistently with FF 3.6 (see screenshot) with the time being placed in the line underneath the title of what was recently updated.
fields.summary: Layout of "Recently Updated" for Easy Reader theme in IE7 only

fields.description: Found while investigating CONF-19152, refreshing the Dashboard in sIEve for IE7 shows 2 DOM nodes leaking and a lot of memory. It may be contributing to the slowdown and eventual failure of the IE7 Selenium build.
fields.summary: Dashboard is leaking memory in IE7

fields.description: There is a compile time dependency between the functional tests and the confluence core which causes NoClassDefFoundErrors when run inside IDEA.
fields.summary: Confluence Functional Tests have compile time dependency on Confluence

fields.description:
When exporting a wiki page with nested lists:

# Step1.
## Sub-Step1.
## Sub-Step2.

sub-sections are appearing as numbers instead of a,b,c.
fields.summary: Export to HTML generate different Lists

fields.description: Refactor autocomplete so we can use it to insert other markup, not just links.
fields.summary: Refactor Autocomplete to insert content

fields.description:
From confluence admin, go to security, manage groups. 

From here, it lists the groups associated to your application.

Want to be able to search that group - as it will be much quicker to locate any particular group through a search feature on that page.
fields.summary: Search groups in confluence admin

fields.description: After upgrading Confluence Usage Tracking Plugin, the plugin would disable itself every time confluence restarts.
fields.summary: Confluence Usage Tracking Plugin will not stay enabled
DefaultUserAccessor#addMembership fails if Anonymous can't use Confluence
'Did You Mean' feature should clarify which English locale it works with

fields.description:
To give more exposure to the template bundles available on PAC could we please link to them from the docs?

This page would be best:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Importing+Templates

This is the specific link to templates on PAC:

https://plugins.atlassian.com/search/category/20177
fields.summary: Add links to Template Bundles on PAC to documentation

fields.description:
When I try to upload files via WebDav (finder, Mac OSX 1.6.3), if the directory depth is greater than one - like a new page beneath a space - the file disappears. It shows up briefly in Confluence (eg. recently updated in the dashboard). Then is vanishes (upon releading the page). It vanishes from the finder too.
If I upload a file (eg. n.zip) to the root dir of a space, then the file is visible in the finder and in recently updated but not in the attachments area.
As it stands right now the WebDAV feature is not usable at all.
This problem can be reproduced with a Windows WebDAV client too.
fields.summary: Files uploaded via WebDAV disappear if directory depth >1

fields.description:
I used the viewfile macro to embed a pdf from another space. It gave me an error and said to contact Atlassian. Code:

{viewfile:space=hr|page=Phone lists, contacts|name=Contacts.pdf}
fields.summary: problem with converting attachment

fields.description:
After entering database connection information for localhost PostgreSQL instance, browser never completes to next task (twirling icon in Firefox) http://localhost:8080/confluence/setup/setupstandarddb.action

Confirmed confluence user can log in. pgAdminIII indicates 40 tables have been created in the confluence database.

Reattempt gives "Database contains confluence data" error; selecting continue and overwrite gives same never completing symptom.

Cannot get past this to load content from backup, so I am blocked. New installation cannot proceed.
fields.summary: PostgreSQL configuration never completes

fields.description:
Hi the forum site does not seem to capture the info properly:
the top section about "Ths question is not answered. Helpful replies = X and Correct Asnwers available = y"

but the x & y don't seem to appear correct, and the same values are there for lots of other cases (maybe even all)?


regards,
Paul
fields.summary: Website doesnt seem to track Correct Asnwers stats properly
